subject: Philosophy
title: The Preservation of Greek Thought
description: A 60-second lesson on The Preservation of Greek Thought.

hook.text: When Rome fell, Greek philosophy nearly vanished from Europe. It was saved by Islamic scholars.

buildup.text: Arab translators in Baghdad preserved Aristotle, Plato, and others during Europe's Dark Ages.

discovery.text: Scholars like Averroes and Avicenna didn't just translate â€” they commented, critiqued, and advanced Greek ideas.

twist.text: When these texts returned to Europe through Spain, they sparked the Renaissance and the Scientific Revolution.

climax.text: Without Islamic scholarship, Western philosophy might have lost its Greek foundations entirely.

punchline.text: Greek wisdom survived because the Islamic world kept it alive.

quiz.question: How were Greek philosophical texts preserved during the European Dark Ages?
